channel.title: TIME Magazine Online: Top Stories
channel.description: TIME's top stories of the day
channel.copyright: Copyright @ 2006 Time Inc. All rights reserved.
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: Olmert Comes Calling
item.description: Analysis: Why Bush was lukewarm on the prime minister's plan to redraw Israel's borders

item.title: The Final Milestone in Iraq?
item.description: Viewpoint: The President has hailed the new Iraqi government as a turning point. But what happens when you run out of turning points?

item.title: A New Bird Flu Cluster
item.description: Eight family members in rural Indonesia fall ill, and medical investigators are racing to figure out why

item.title: Will Neo-Nazis Disupt the World Cup?
item.description: An upsurge in far-right attacks is causing concern in Germany as the soccer tournament nears

item.title: The Hit-and-Run Grandmas
item.description: Los Angeles police accuse two elderly women of taking out life insurance policies on homeless men before murdering them

item.title: No Child Left Behind: Giving the States a Break
item.description: The Department of Education is showing new leniency on Bush's tough school standards. But the tests aren't going away

item.title: Stopping Jumpers on the Golden Gate
item.description: Aided by one man who survived his own attempt, a campaign to build a barrier to prevent suicides on the landmark bridge is causing a stir in San Francisco

item.title: Chicks In the Line of Fire
item.description: Three years ago they apologized for dissing the President. Now, they're back with a new album - and a retraction of the apology

item.title: Flash! ABC Picks Old White Male Anchor
item.description: Charlie Gibson gets the nod as ABC's anti-Couric on World News Tonight. A safe move, but maybe smart
